div.p: Having within the last few days received several letters containing inquiries respecting my opinions upon the subject of the Catholic claims, permit me to state shortly but explicitly that I am, and always have been, decidedly adverse to those claims, and should I be so fortunate as to attain the distinguished honor which I am now soliciting, I shall feel it my duty, as a representative of the University of Cambridge, to oppose them, in my place in Parliament, to the utmost of my ability and power.

Suffer me to add in reference to reports which have been actively circulated in the University, that there is not the least prospect of my being prevented by any change of situation, from redeeming the pledge which I have given to my friends, of submitting myself to the judgement of the members of the Senate of the day of the election, the result of which appeal, from the many kind and flattering assurances of support that I have received, I may venture to anticipate with confidence and pride.
